meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a clique.
meanings.sent1: The group of friends had a cliquish attitude, always sticking together.
meanings.sent2: Her behavior became cliquish as she only interacted with a select few.
meanings.sent3: The cliquish nature of the book club made it hard for new members to join.
meanings.sent4: The cliquish behavior in the office was like an invisible barrier to outsiders.
meanings.sent5: The cliquish atmosphere at the party made it feel exclusive and unwelcoming.

meanings.sent1: The students' cliquish behavior made it difficult for others to join their group.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood had a cliquish vibe, with each group keeping to themselves.
meanings.sent3: The cliquish cats in the alley formed their own exclusive club.
meanings.sent4: The cliquish clouds in the sky seemed to gather together, excluding others.
meanings.sent5: The cliquish plants in the garden only thrived when surrounded by their preferred companions.
